instruction: Look up the latest version of the given policy and list the key points.
output: The Uniform Code of Military Justice (UCMJ) is an extensive set of laws and regulations governing the conduct of members of the US military. The latest version of the UCMJ, published in 2018, contains seven Articles that provide the basis for military law. The key points of the UCMJ include: taking responsibility for reporting any violation of the UCMJ; protecting the rights of both accused and accuser; outlining the types of offenses and their punishments; ensuring sentence of punishment is correctly determined; determining the process of seeking clemency or relief; and providing guidance for who has primary authority for the enforcement of the UCMJ.
